title: Single Number
description:
Single Number

Given a non-empty array of integers nums, every element appears twice except for one. Find that single one.

You must implement a solution with a linear runtime complexity and use only constant extra space.

Examples:

  • Input: nums = [2,2,1]
    Output: 1
  • Input: nums = [4,1,2,1,2]
    Output: 4
  • Input: nums = [1]
    Output: 1

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 3 * 104
  • -3 * 104 <= nums[i] <= 3 * 104
  • Each element in the array appears twice except for one element which appears only once.
solution_text:
Single Number

Algorithm:

  1. Use the XOR bitwise operation to find the unique number
  2. Initialize result to 0
  3. XOR all numbers in the array with the result
  4. Since XOR of identical numbers equals 0, and XOR of any number with 0 equals the number itself, all pairs cancel out
  5. The remaining value is the single number that appears only once

Time Complexity: O(n) - single pass through the array

Space Complexity: O(1) - constant extra space

Key Insights:

  • XOR has commutative and associative properties: order doesn't matter
  • XOR of identical values equals 0: a XOR a = 0
  • XOR of any value with 0 equals the value: a XOR 0 = a
  • All duplicate pairs cancel out, leaving only the single number
